caption: KYIV Missiles from an overnight strike mangled an apartment building in the capital.
image_1.context: It may not be the worst of times, but it is certainly not the best of times. The pandemic has no end in sight. The world is warming, the seas are rising and polar bears are barreling toward extinction. Also: taxes, the 9-to-5 workweek, the renewed threat of nuclear war. As people looked for someone to blame besides themselves and all of humanity, a culprit emerged in the form of a fish, specifically the 375-million-year-old Tiktaalik (pronounced tic-TAH-lick). Our modern woes would never have existed if our ancestors had By SABRINA IMBLER Is Four-Footed Fish to Blame for World’s Woes?   with the pugilistic brand of conservatism owned by Donald J. Trump and now amplified by the new band of Buckeye bomb throwers. The race descended into a brutal slugfest as the leading candidates, the author-turned-venture capitalist J.D. Vance, the former state treasurer Josh Mandel and a self-funded businessman, Mike Gibbons, entered the final weekend before Tuesday’s primaries accusing one another of being insufficiently right-wing or disloyal to the man in Mar-a-Lago. Ohio used to be known for the quiet conservatism of the state’s former senator George Voinovich and its current governor, Mike DeWine; for the Merlot-swilling Continued on Page A13
image_1.description: The image depicts a scene of destruction and devastation following an overnight missile strike in Kyiv. The focal point is a partially collapsed apartment building with exposed structural elements and debris scattered around. A person, possibly a woman, is visible through a doorway or window opening, peering out amidst the ruins. The walls and ceiling are heavily damaged, with chunks of concrete and twisted metal reinforcing bars protruding from the wreckage. The overall atmosphere is one of shock and desolation, highlighting the human impact of the conflict. The lighting suggests daylight, casting shadows that accentuate the severity of the damage. The scene conveys a sense of urgency and tragedy, capturing the aftermath of a violent event in an urban setting.

image_2.description: The image depicts a devastated rural scene, likely in the aftermath of conflict. The foreground shows a dirt road flanked by extensive debris and remnants of destroyed structures. On the left side of the road, there are scattered pieces of burnt wood, metal, and other materials, indicating heavy destruction. A few trees with bare branches suggest it might be early spring or late autumn. In the background, there are partially destroyed buildings, some with visible damage to their roofs and walls. Two individuals, possibly soldiers, are seen walking along the road. One is closer to the foreground on the left side, while the other is further back on the right side. The sky is partly cloudy, providing a stark contrast to the desolate landscape below. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of desolation and aftermath of a significant event, likely related to military conflict.

caption: KHARKIV Refugees fled to Ukraine’s second-largest city, escaping fighting in Ruska Lozova.

image_3.description: The image depicts a blue car with significant damage, including multiple bullet holes and shattered windows. The car's paint is chipped and worn, indicating it has been through considerable hardship. On the driver's side, an elderly person wearing a red headscarf is seated, appearing to be in a state of distress or contemplation. The passenger window is broken, and a dog is visible looking out from the back seat, its expression one of alertness or concern. The background shows a blurred outdoor setting, suggesting the car is parked on a street or in a parking lot. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of tension and urgency, likely related to the context of conflict or crisis mentioned in the caption.

caption: A Taneco oil refinery in Russia.
image_4.context: Indonesia, which produces more than half the world’s palm oil, has halted outgoing shipments. Turkey has stopped exports of butter, beef, lamb, goats, maize and vegetable oils. Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has unleashed a new wave of protectionism as governments, desperate to secure food and other commodities for their citizens amid shortages and rising WASHINGTON — Ukraine has limited exports of sunflower oil, wheat, oats and cattle in an attempt to protect its war-torn economy. Russia has banned sales of fertilizer, sugar and grains to other nations. By ANA SWANSON As Food Exports Are Blocked, Ripples Are Felt Around Globe said on Fri  day. Britain’s Defense Intelligence agency largely concurred, saying on Friday that “Russian territorial gains have been limited and achieved at significant cost to Russian forces.” In a video released on Friday, an aide to the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelensky, called the Russian losses “colossal.” The Russian military is trying to encircle Ukrainian troops in the Donbas region by attacking from the north, east and south, but has made little progress, experts and Pentagon officials say. Victory in the Donbas cam paign is vital to Moscow’s plans of carving out a large chunk of southContinued on Page A6
image_4.description: The image depicts a large industrial complex, specifically an oil refinery. The scene is set during twilight or early evening, as indicated by the sky transitioning from blue to shades of orange and pink. Dominating the foreground is a tall, cylindrical chimney painted in alternating bands of red and white. This chimney is a prominent feature of the refinery and stands out against the sky. Surrounding the chimney are numerous interconnected structures and frameworks, indicative of the intricate network of pipes, tanks, and processing units typical of an oil refinery. These structures are illuminated by artificial lighting, casting a warm glow that contrasts with the cooler tones of the sky. The background features a clear horizon with a few scattered clouds, adding depth to the scene. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of industrial activity and complexity, highlighting the scale and intricacy of modern refining operations.

Downriver, four other soldiers stood by as a U.S. Border Patrol team detained dozens of newly arrived migrants in a pecan orchard. An agent with a crowd counter recorded 135 people, mostly men but also families from Cuba, Peru and Venezuela who were seeking asylum in the United States.  “This is it, every day,” said Hal Bowles, a Maverick County deputy constable who has been hired with new state funding to work on border security. “The governor is Continued on Page A16
image_5.description: The image depicts a large group of people gathered in front of the Dome of the Rock, a significant Islamic shrine located on the Temple Mount in Jerusalem. The building itself is an octagonal structure with a prominent golden dome and intricate blue and white mosaic patterns on its exterior walls. The sky is overcast, giving the scene a somewhat somber atmosphere. The crowd consists of numerous individuals, many of whom are dressed in traditional Muslim attire, including headscarves and long robes. Some people appear to be engaged in prayer or contemplation, while others are simply standing or walking around. The overall mood of the image conveys a sense of reverence and solemnity as the worshippers gather for their religious observance.

image_6.description: The image depicts two individuals in a kitchen or food preparation area. Both individuals are wearing face masks, indicating a setting that requires health and safety precautions. The person on the left is seated and appears to be handling a large box of baked goods, possibly donuts or pastries. The box is open, revealing several rows of these items. The individual on the right is standing and holding up a plastic bag containing what looks like a sandwich or some other type of food item. The background shows various kitchen equipment and supplies, including stacked boxes, a coffee machine, and a bottle of hand sanitizer. The overall atmosphere suggests a scene of food distribution or preparation, possibly in a charitable or community service context.

image_7.context: ARTS C1-7 The Pieces Inside a Masterpiece The objects featured in Matisse’s “Red Studio” painting have been brought together in a spectacular show at the Museum of Modern Art. PAGE C1 Michelle Goldberg OPINION A20-21         practices are now said to be unlikely in the foreseeable future. PAGE A19 BUSINESS B1-5 The Toll of Faraway Battles The war in Ukraine has raised energy costs in Britain, putting more stress on the older and the vulnerable. PAGE B1 Possible Headache for Twitter Elon Musk has invested heavily in China, which is willing to punish companies that cross political lines. PAGE B1 Pitcher Gets Long Suspension Major League Baseball suspended the Dodgers’ Trevor Bauer for two seasons under its policy on domestic violence and sexual assault. If an appeal fails, he could lose tens of millions. PAGE B7
image_7.description: The image depicts a person standing in front of a large painting, viewed from behind. The individual is wearing a black hat and a dark jacket, facing a vibrant artwork that dominates the frame. The painting itself is a vivid representation of an artist's studio, characterized by a bold orange background. Various objects are scattered throughout the painting, including easels, paintings within paintings, sculptures, and other artistic paraphernalia. The objects are rendered in a variety of colors and shapes, creating a dynamic and lively scene. The overall atmosphere conveyed by the painting is one of creativity and artistic expression. The person appears to be observing the artwork intently, suggesting a moment of contemplation or appreciation.
